text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to 
hot Thai kitchen still lockdown Edition so today I

wanted to share with you a recipe that I think 
is the perfect lockdown recipe it's something

called Pad woon sen which is glass noodle stir-fry 
simply but it's also known as woon sen pad kai

which means glass noodle stir fried with eggs yes 
the eggs make this really really good we've been

on lockdown here in Vancouver for about a month 
now and so I've had a lot of time to think about

what is the perfect lockdown recipe like what 
qualities does the dish need to have in order

for it to be considered the perfect lockdown dish 
so I've concluded that there are five different

qualities one it has to use ingredients that 
are easy as if easy to find and lasts a long

time in your fridge - it has to be quick and 
easy which you know what a lot of you may have

a lot of extra time on your hands right now but 
if you're working from home with kids like we are

you need quick more than anything right now and 
in theory it has to be a flexible recipe meaning

that if you don't have all the things that I have 
you can substitute the heck out of this dish and

it'll still turn out okay and this is definitely 
one of those dishes for it should be inexpensive

and that's important because times are tough a 
lot of people are having to cut their budgets

down so this is not gonna break the bank and of 
course finally it has to taste good cuz it's not

the happiest times right now and delicious food 
is one of those things that's going to brighten

your day and this pad one Zen dish has all of 
those qualities I do have a pad once and recipe

already but this one has been modified for a 
lockdown so let's get started so as many of

you know this year one of our show sponsors is 
Pine brand glass noodles and as I was thinking

about glass noodle recipe I realized that this is 
the perfect lockdown ingredient because it's easy

to find it's cheap it's super versatile and 
it's really quick too so I thought hey this

is a good opportunity to do something with glass 
noodles and rest this recipe is also sponsored by

Pine brand I love pine bran again because it's 
a hundred percent mung bean start and when you

look for glass noodles that's what you want to 
look for and it will have the best texture and

all you need to do with glass noodles you soak 
it in water for about seven to ten minutes just

until it's soft and pliable like this now a tip 
when you drain it so I've soaked this and I've

drained these don't tossed it because then what 
you want to do is you want to cut them with your

scissors okay because right now it's a little too 
long so just coming a little closer so you can

see so just go right in the middle and cut there 
we go and then it's shorter it's a little easier

to cook to serve and all this stuff and now you 
can mix them up as much as you want you can cut

them even shorter especially if you've got kids 
it may be easier for them to you know grab the

noodles if they're not so long now vegetables 
you can substitute whatever vegetables you want

like as I said this is a very flexible recipe 
but I want to use some really basic basic stuff

cabbage which by the way if you want to stock up 
on vegetables cabbage last like three months in

your fridge something ridiculous like that carrots 
also last a really long time if you want to make

them last longer make sure they're kept in the 
bag so they don't lose moisture and become wilty

so carrots and then I've got some onions and some 
garlic and some white pepper right these are all

things that you might already have in your fridge 
they last a really long time you can find anywhere

for a little extra greenery you can do some green 
onions which you don't have to do this is totally

just you know optional it will not break the dish 
if you don't have it cilantro whatever greenery

is fine also I want to add a little tip if you 
need to stretch your green onions use only the

green part I usually use the whole thing but 
if you want it to last a little longer leave

the white part in water just leave this sitting 
outside and it will generate more green onions

I don't know where it's drawing substance from 
like it's just sitting in water but eventually

more green will come out of here and so you can 
stretch it a little bit longer I have not tested

out like how long it will grow but hey something 
to do and then you can have like all of your green

onion ends in here and you have little green 
onion factory oh no the baby's awake I will be

right back okay I'm back I managed to put him back 
to sleep this is my life now I do everything when

he naps and when he goes to sleep at night anyway 
one more thing this dish always uses tomatoes and

it's really important at bright acidity tomatoes 
may not be something you want to keep right now

as it doesn't last very long but here's a tip 
you can use can drained diced tomatoes so just

canned diced tomatoes unsalted is better and you 
want to drain it see how this juice and you can

keep the juice for soup or whatever and you can 
still throw these into a stir fry it works in

a pinch okay doesn't look as pretty but it's a 
great little trick now I'm gonna move on to the

sauce which is really simple I've got in here some 
oyster sauce and I'm just going to add some soy

sauce so two parts Oster sauce one part soy sauce 
and then half part I'm gonna use golden mountain

sauce which you've seen me used many times it's 
a different type of soy sauce you can just use

fish sauce or just more soy sauce again this is 
a really flexible recipe you can substitute the

heck out of it and it'll be fine okay and then it 
does need some sugar a tablespoon might look like

a lot but we are making a bunch of noodles and it 
glass this recipe really does well with a touch

of sweetness it will not taste sweet at the end I 
promise that's it let's go to the stove let's cook

so it is now two days later because last time 
just as we were about to film this part the baby

woke up and I couldn't put him back to sleep so we 
have to wait another day there you go working at

home with kids if any of you are experiencing the 
same thing I understand okay so now for cooking

I've got a wok right here that I'm heating up and 
just FYI for the wok for this for glass noodles

you do want a nonstick wok because the glass 
noodles can stick a little bit if you're using

a stainless steel or something that's not nonstick 
you might just have to scrape quite a bit as you

go some neutral flavored oil and I use avocado 
oil for my sort of everyday cooking garlic and

no the oil isn't hot yet that's okay it doesn't 
have to be right now actually it's kind of nice

to add the garlic now so that you know when the 
oil is hot cuz the garlic will start to bubble

right okay now the oil is hot I'm gonna add my 
onions and four onions I like to add them early

because I like my onions really nice and soft 
but if you prefer them sort of like crunchy err

you can add them at the end or with the rest of 
the vegetables and right now we're infusing the

oil with all that garlic and onion flavor and it 
is then going to carry that flavor all over our

dish so I'm also gonna add my white pepper here 
to give it a chance to also infuse into the oil

it's a little bit more oil it's looking a little 
dry and while we're waiting for that to cook I

want to show you a little green onion update two 
days ago you saw me put the green onion in the

cups it this two days see you got a and a good 
inch of green onion here where that came from I

don't know but it's pretty cool I can see some 
smallest bits of garlic starting to turn golden

I'm gonna now add my protein so I am using I 
don't remember if I told you about my protein

already I don't think so I'm using ground turkey 
because normally I would use ground pork but hey

for the first time in my life I have went to two 
stores and there was no ground floor as either

of them huh interesting right I guess that's the 
time we're living in the sole ground turkey works

this is dark meat ground turkey don't use like 
ground chicken breasts I did try that once and

it's just way too dry you want something with 
more flavor more fat so definitely dark meat

poultry if you're gonna go poultry and also I want 
to point out that um for budget wise if you were

to use sliced chicken or pork for this you'll end 
up needing more to make it look like a reasonable

amount but if you go with ground meat you don't 
have to use as much because ground beef ground

meat does kind of distribute itself throughout the 
dish so if you're tight on budget ground meat is a

good way to go a little bit goes a long way the 
meat is pretty much done almost done I'm gonna

now going with my vegetables we're going to add a 
little bit of the sauce just because if I add the

sauce all at once when the noodles go in then all 
the noodles absorb the sauce and the vegetables

won't get a chance to really absorb that flavor 
you got a spread the flavor love a minute or so

just to get the vegetables hot in the will hit a 
bit so I prep most of the suit last night because

I don't have time to be prepping it today with 
the baby so that's something you can do as well

cut all the vegetables tonight before okay and 
now the noodles go in with the rest of the sauce

okay and here's a little trick I'm gonna put this 
a little bit of water to rinse out that sauce and

I also find that this dish does need a little 
extra splash of water anyway so it works out

and now you just get toss toss toss toss until 
the noodles absorb all that liquid so as you can

see I'm now using like my home electric stove and 
the heat on here is so much more gentle than the

crazy strong gas burner that I normally use on a 
Thai kitchen so keep tossing so that everything

is evenly distributed this is a really healthy 
dish too as you can see lots of vegetables good

protein and glass noodles is compared to other 
noodles it's the lowest glycemic index noodle and

it also swells up a lot so calorie wise you're 
eating less for what seems like the same amount

of noodles is what if you know what I mean like 
in Thailand glass noodles is sort of considered

by many people SS the the diet noodles should 
I say okay that's looking good now this is your

first time I would taste the noodles see if it 
meets any more liquids if it's fully cooked if

it's a little sip you can add a splash of water 
and keep it cooking but I've done this many times

I know this is good so now the eggs are gonna 
go in I'm gonna make some space I'm gonna add

a little bit more oil just so I have the last 
drops of my oil here and then my eggs go in

oh yeah the eggs really make this dish so don't 
skip that scramble that lately you scramble that

like get a marbling effect going right now I'm 
gonna put all of my noodles on top of the eggs

and I'll let that cook for another 30 seconds 
if you have seen my original parkinson recipe I

added the eggs earlier and I am changing my mind 
on that now like adding aches earlier is sort of

the common thing that people do but I find that 
the eggs then end up overcooking because then by

the time everything else goes in it's overcooked 
so doing it this way with the egg being the last

thing keeps the eggs nice and tender okay so 
now we're going to flip the eggs there we go

the egg is perfectly cooked oh no escaping 
food and it's holding on to some of the

noodles perfect by the way if you want to 
know what this wok is I got it as it was

like a secret santa thing we did in Thailand and 
it's from Korea I forget what the name is it's

like a Korean brand if you know please tell me 
in the comment okay tomatoes going on them and

then you do a final toss I'm going to switch to 
tongs now and I have to be careful because my

tongs are metal so I have to be careful not 
to scrape the wok with the metal I actually

kind of like using canned tomato for this 
because the little bit of the juice that does

come along that's a nice flavor for the noodles 
actually okay that is done see how easy is that

almost lost okay oh look at that Wow so one of the 
adjustments that I made for this lock down version

of Parkinson is it a much bigger portion because 
I figured you probably have more people staying

at home all the kids are probably home maybe you 
want to have this for lunch or something and you

know leftovers are always good yes look at that 
and you know what because this is the second time

that I filmed this I forgot the green onions so 
no green onions look at these I just love glass

noodles so much oh yes so good this is like the 
flavor of my childhood it's such a kid-friendly

recipe yet it's a really popular dish for adults 
as well by the way speaking of like lock down

recipe glass noodles last at least five years 
without going back now five years is like the

official statement from the company but I am sure 
it was even longer than that because nothing in

here no oils or anything that's gonna go rancid 
by contrast if you've been stocking up on instant

noodles for example instant noodles will go bad 
so relatively quickly because there's oils and

things in those noodles right so this is a 
great one to stop now the key question is do

baby approved yummy so the recipe has always
